thread.title: BMC election results 2017: Here is the full list of winners, Shiv Sena bags 84 seats, Snehal Ambekar big winner; BJP gets 81 seats, Neil Somaiya puts up fine show
thread.title_full: BMC election results 2017: Here is the full list of winners, Shiv Sena bags 84 seats, Snehal Ambekar big winner; BJP gets 81 seats, Neil Somaiya puts up fine show - The Financial Express

author: FE Online
title: BMC election results 2017: Here is the full list of winners, Shiv Sena bags 84 seats, Snehal Ambekar big winner; BJP gets 81 seats, Neil Somaiya puts up fine show
text:
There was a lot at stake for both Shiv Sena and the BJP, two saffron allies for over 20 years, who have been going through a fallout(PTI) Shiv Sena was declared the winner of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation Elections 2017 with 84, while its bitter allies, the Bhartiya Janata Party came mighty close with 81 seats of its own. There was a lot at stake for both Shiv Sena and the BJP , two saffron allies for over 20 years, who have been going through a fallout. Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray had openly criticised the BJP government in the state under Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and Prime Minister Narendra Modi ’s demonetisation scheme. For the most part of the day, it looked as if the Shiv Sena would run away with an absolute majority for more time but BJP changed gears towards the end of the day and raced to 82 seats. Although, since none of the parties gained the required 114 seats to reach an absolute majority, the picture still remains unclear as to who will take over the reigns of the richest Municipal corporation in the world.
In the weeks leading to the BMC polls, Shiv Sena had launched a series of attacks directed towards the Bhartiya Janata Party. Shiv Sena supremo Uddhav Thackeray had spoken against the demonetisation drive citing the problems faced by the common man. Later, after weeks of silence on the part of BJP, the party had released a cartoon video, calling Shiv Sena as the “Khau Sena” and criticised it for its corrupt activities. Earlier today, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari is happy with BJP’s performance and congratulated party workers. “For the first time, BJP has got such unprecedented success. I congratulate Maharashtra CM &BJP workers,” he had said.
Here is the list of winners for Shiv Sena
Tejasvini Ghosalkar
Anil Kokil
Shraddha Jadhav
Milind Vaidya
Sindhu Masurkar
Swapnil Tembvalkar
Surendra Baglar
Vishakha Raut
Suresh Patil
Arundhati Dhudhadvkar
Deepali Gosavi
List of winners for BJP:
Neil Somaia
Parag Shah
Anita Panchal
Anuradha Poddar
Harshda Navorkar
Deepak Thakur
Manoj Kotak
Prakash Gangadhare
Kalpana Keni
Madhoon Prabhakar Shinde
Smita Kamble
List of winners for Congress :
Asha Koparkar
Asha Koparkar Sushma Kamlesh Rai
Sushma Kamlesh RaiVinni Disojha
Vinni DisojhaNikita Nikam
Nikita Nikam
(Further details awaited)
Meanwhile, in Pune, the BJP was leading the battle with 77 seats and was well on its way to defeat the Sharad Pawar-led National Congress Party. Congress, Shiv Sena and Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) are trailing way behind in Pune. It must be noted that 82 wards were needed for an absolute majority and BJP is inching closer. However, if they fall short of that mark, Shiv Sena could play the pivotal role. The bitter allies could come together in the city despite differences between the party heads.
